radiographic_examinations.findings: The appendix is fluid-filled and dilated up to 8 mm, with mucosal hyperenhancement and mild surrounding fat stranding, consistent with early appendicitis. Visualized lung fields are within normal limits. No evidence of pleural or pericardial effusion. The liver, pancreas, spleen, and adrenal glands show normal size and attenuation without evidence of lesions. Kidneys appear normal with no evidence of renal lesions or hydronephrosis. Stomach and small bowel are unremarkable. Trace simple free fluid is noted in the pelvis.
